nodes.bodyText: This change is just to be consistent with linux_artifacts.cfg. Ditto for windows.cfg. The [] syntax is poor for these long strings.
Why this is changed to only publish core publication?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -88,8 +88,16 @@ if [[ -z "${ALL_ARTIFACTS:-}" ]]; then
   ./gradlew grpc-compiler:build grpc-compiler:publish $GRADLE_FLAGS \
     -Dorg.gradle.parallel=false -PrepositoryDir=$LOCAL_MVN_TEMP
 else
-  ./gradlew publish $GRADLE_FLAGS \
+  ./gradlew publish :grpc-core:versionFile $GRADLE_FLAGS \

nodes.bodyText: I added to it. publish is there to export to the local maven repository. versionFile is there because we copy it from the build/ directory. The point of having a task create the version file is to avoid yet another place we have to manually change the version when doing a release.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -88,8 +88,16 @@ if [[ -z "${ALL_ARTIFACTS:-}" ]]; then
   ./gradlew grpc-compiler:build grpc-compiler:publish $GRADLE_FLAGS \
     -Dorg.gradle.parallel=false -PrepositoryDir=$LOCAL_MVN_TEMP
 else
-  ./gradlew publish $GRADLE_FLAGS \
+  ./gradlew publish :grpc-core:versionFile $GRADLE_FLAGS \

nodes.bodyText: I mean, previously it publishes all publications, but now it has been changed to only publish core?
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
My bad my bad. That was just running two tasks. Equivalent to
./gradlew publish
./gradlew :grpc-core:versionFile
